snippet: In his annual speech, the governor pointed out real progress made toward ending the “dysfunction” in government, but Albany still has a long way to go.
abstract: Editorial welcomes many accomplishments and goals laid out in New York Gov Andrew Cuomo's State of the State address; expresses concern that Cuomo will rely too heavily on gambling to bolster state economy in coming year; contends his plans for educational reform are sound, but must focus more on improving schools in poorer districts.
lead_paragraph: In his annual speech, the governor pointed out real progress made toward ending the “dysfunction” in government, but Albany still has a long way to go.
